frontmatter.title: Review of Identity Instrumentalized
frontmatter.description: This is a review of journal article titled "Identity Instrumentalized," which recounts an intriguing history of how computer scientist Woodrow Wilson Bledsoe and his Panoramic Research Incorporated (PRI) laid down the foundational  works for computerized facial recognition algorithms using the funding from the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) during  the 1960s United States, and how  individual identities were being re-interpreted, re-configured, and instrumentalized to adapted for automated pattern  matching algorithms within the process.
